intro: Halimocnemis pilifera, commonly known as the hairy sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, leaf-like structures that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white, and it thrives in well-drained sandy soils. Halimocnemis pilifera is well adapted to drought conditions, with its fleshy stems storing water and reducing transpiration. It is often found in coastal and inland dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
